intro: Campanula rigidipila var. sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features upright stems that produce clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to spread via stolons.
